qas.question: What is the title of the film where a man becomes permanently grounded in an airport terminal?
When was the movie Airport made?
When was the movie Final Destination released?
In what year was the Langoliers made?
What movie is about a man who is trapped in a race to an airport terminal from 1970?

plausible_answers.text: Lost, The Amazing Race, America's Next Top Model, Cycle 10

qas.question: What tv shows have surviving on food and shelter provided by an airport a main theme?

plausible_answers.text: due to their very nature as a transport and international hub

qas.question: Why did Good Will Hunting use a certain airport as an image of survival in 2000?
In what year was Get Shorty released?

context: Airports have played major roles in films and television programs <b6_0>due to their very nature as a transport and international hub<b6_0/>, and sometimes because of distinctive architectural features of particular airports. One such example of this is <a0_0>The Terminal<a0_0/>, a film about a man who becomes permanently grounded in an airport terminal and must survive only on the food and shelter provided by the airport. They are also one of the major elements in movies such as The V.I.P.s, Airplane!, Airport <b3_0>(<a1_0>1970<a1_0/>)<b3_0/>, Die Hard 2, Soul Plane, Jackie Brown, Get Shorty, Home Alone, Liar Liar, Passenger 57, Final Destination <b7_0>(<a2_0>2000<a2_0/>)<b7_0/>, Unaccompanied Minors, Catch Me If You Can, Rendition and The Langoliers. They have also played important parts in television series like <b5_0>Lost, <b4_0>The Amazing Race<b4_0/>, America's Next Top Model, Cycle 10<b5_0/> which have significant parts of their story set within airports. In other programmes and films, airports are merely indicative of journeys, e.g. Good Will Hunting.
